qas.question: How much rain falls on Mexico City?
When is it warm, yet does not rain?
When does the majority of the rain fall in Mexico City?
When is it coldest in Mexico City?
What mostly controls the rain in Mexico City?

context: The area receives about <a0_0>820 millimetres (32.3 in)<a0_0/> of annual rainfall, which is concentrated from June through September/October with little or no precipitation the remainder of the year. The area has two main seasons. The rainy season runs from <a2_0>June to October<a2_0/> when winds bring in tropical moisture from the sea. The dry season runs from November to May, when the air is relatively drier. This dry season subdivides into a cold period and a warm period. The cold period spans from <a3_0>November to February<a3_0/> when polar air masses push down from the north and keep the air fairly dry. The warm period extends from <a1_0>March to May<a1_0/> when <a4_0>tropical winds<a4_0/> again dominate but do not yet carry enough moisture for rain.
